| HistoryText             = The Vermin was a group of [[Glossary:Clone|clones]] of the original [[Edward Whelan (Earth-616)|Vermin]] created during [[Sergei Kravinoff (Earth-616)|Kraven the Hunter]]'s Great Hunt in [[Central Park]], when [[Arcade (Earth-616)|Arcade]] injected him with a special drug that made him grow clones out of his body, giving him the company he always longed for.{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 5 20.HU}}

Once [[Peter Parker (Earth-616)|Spider-Man]] attempted to confront Kraven at the [[Central Park Zoo]], Arcade set the Vermin loose on him.{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 5 20}} They almost killed Spider-Man until Kraven used a sonic weapon to scatter them.{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 5 21}} Following the end of Kraven's Great Hunt, the Vermin retreated to the subway.{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 5 23}}

During Spider-Man and [[Frederick Myers (Earth-616)|Boomerang]]'s quest in the search for the scattered pieces of the [[Lifeline Tablet]], they ventured underground and stumbled into the Vermin. They were quickly swarmed and almost subdued by the creatures until [[Gog (Tsiln) (Earth-616)|Gog]], the guardian of the final piece of the Tablet, resurfaced, driving the Vermin away.{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 5 41}}

When a group of Vermin resurfaced to terrorize a building in search for people to eat, one of the neighbors sought the help of [[Marc Spector (Earth-616)|Moon Knight]]. While fighting the creatures, Moon Knight hurled one of the Vermin off the building, killing it, as a warning. Threatening to kill all of the Vermin, Moon Knight prompted the creatures to flee.{{r|Moon Knight Vol 9 1}}
